content:
Diagnosis:	Locally advanced esophageal squamous cell carcinoma

Management:	Completed definitive chemoradiotherapy March 2024

Histology:	Moderately differentiated squamous cell carcinoma, p16 negative, PDL1 CPS 4

Current Situation:	First follow-up post treatment completion

I reviewed [redacted name] in clinic today following completion of definitive chemoradiotherapy for his stage III esophageal cancer. He completed treatment on 15/3/24 and has made a good recovery from the acute side effects. His swallowing has significantly improved and he is managing a soft diet without requiring supplementary nutrition. Weight has stabilized at 72kg. He denies any new symptoms and maintains PS 1. Clinical examination today was unremarkable.

I have arranged a surveillance CT chest/abdomen/pelvis for 3 months' time and will review him with the results. I have provided advice regarding red flag symptoms and contact details for the support team if needed before the next appointment.

cancer_timeline.value: Good recovery from acute treatment side effects with improved swallowing

patient_facts.value: Managing soft diet without supplementary nutrition

status_updates.value: Stage III esophageal SCC post definitive chemoradiotherapy. Stable disease with good recovery from treatment effects
Improved swallowing function post treatment completion
Review with CT results in 3 months
